item.title: [翻译] Latent Space: OpenAI完成史上最大初创融资1100亿美元，投后估值8400亿
item.description:
标签: #OpenAI #巨额融资 #AI投资 #科技巨头

摘要: OpenAI以8400亿美元投后估值完成1100亿美元融资，由Amazon、NVIDIA和SoftBank共同领投，创下初创公司史上最大融资纪录；公司同时披露ChatGPT周活用户突破9亿、付费企业用户超900万等强劲增长数据。

原标题: [AINews] OpenAI closes $110B raise from Amazon, NVIDIA, SoftBank in largest startup fundraise in history @ $840B post-money

AI News for 2/26/2026-2/27/2026. We checked 12 subreddits, 544 Twitters and 24 Discords (263 channels, and 12529 messages) for you. Estimated reading time saved (at 200wpm): 1189 minutes. AINews' website lets you search all past issues. As a reminder, AINews is now a section of Latent Space. You can opt in/out of email frequencies!

2026年2月26日至27日的AI新闻。我们为您检查了12个Reddit子版块、544个Twitter账号和24个Discord服务器（263个频道，共12,529条消息）。预计节省阅读时间（按每分钟200词计算）：1189分钟。AINews的网站可让您搜索所有往期内容。提醒：AINews现已成为Latent Space的一个栏目。您可以选择接收邮件的频率！

Against the backdrop of nonstop positioning with the Department of War (Anthropic refusing terms vs OpenAI doing a deal), OpenAI finally closed the much debated Big Round that had been started since December. In the post, they make several interesting new disclosures:

在战争部（Department of War）持续施压的背景下（Anthropic拒绝条款 vs OpenAI达成交易），OpenAI终于完成了自12月启动以来备受争议的大规模融资轮。在公告中，他们披露了几项引人注目的新数据：

  • Weekly Codex users have more than tripled since the start of the year to 1.6M (was 1M on Feb 4 (!!?!?!))

  • 每周Codex用户自年初以来增长超过两倍，达到160万（2月4日时为100万，!!?!?!）

  • More than 9 million paying business users rely on ChatGPT for work (was 3M in June 2025)

  • 超过900万付费企业用户依赖ChatGPT办公（2025年6月时为300万）

  • ChatGPT is where people start with AI, with more than 900M weekly active users, and we now have more than 50 million consumer subscribers (monetization continuing to accelerate in Jan/Feb) (was 800M in Oct 2025, 35M paying in July)

  • ChatGPT是人们接触AI的起点，拥有超过9亿周活跃用户，且我们现有超过5000万消费者订阅用户（1月/2月商业化持续加速）（2025年10月时为8亿，7月付费用户为3500万）

All this justifies $110B in new investment at a $730B pre-money valuation:

所有这些数据证明了在投前估值7300亿美元基础上进行1100亿美元新投资的合理性：

  • $30B from SoftBank ("advancing our own ASI strategy"),

  • 软银（SoftBank）出资300亿美元（"推进我们自身的ASI（Artificial Superintelligence，人工超级智能）战略"），

  • $30B from NVIDIA (including the use of 3 GW of dedicated inference capacity and 2 GW of training on Vera Rubin systems) - down from "up to $100B", still with circular funding concerns

  • 英伟达（NVIDIA）出资300亿美元（包括使用3吉瓦专用推理算力和2吉瓦Vera Rubin系统训练算力）——较此前"高达1000亿美元"的传闻有所下降，仍存在循环注资（circular funding）担忧

  • $50B from Amazon with increased partnership (analysis) involving:
    • an initial $15 billion investment and followed by another $35 billion in the coming months when certain conditions are met — leaving Amazon with a large stake in both OpenAI and Anthropic
    • "Stateful Runtime Environment" powered by OpenAI on Amazon Bedrock
    • AWS will be the exclusive third-party cloud provider for OpenAI Frontier
    • 2 gigawatts of Trainium capacity through AWS infrastructure worth "$100 billion over 8 years", spanning both Trainium3 and next-gen Trainium4 chips

  • 亚马逊（Amazon）出资500亿美元，并达成深化合作（分析）：
    • 初期投资150亿美元，未来数月满足特定条件后再追加350亿美元——这将使亚马逊在OpenAI和Anthropic中均持有大量股份
    • 由OpenAI提供支持的"有状态运行时环境"（Stateful Runtime Environment）运行于Amazon Bedrock
    • AWS将成为OpenAI Frontier的独家第三方云提供商
    • 通过AWS基础设施提供2吉瓦Trainium算力，8年期价值"1000亿美元"，涵盖Trainium3及下一代Trainium4芯片

Close watchers might notice the absence of Microsoft, which continues the existing reduced partnership and gets the stateless APIs.

密切关注者可能注意到微软（Microsoft）的缺席，后者继续维持现有缩减版合作关系，并获得无状态API（stateless APIs）访问权限。

To put this in perspective, 118 countries/economies have a nominal GDP below $100B — roughly 61% of all world economies. Because the consecutive "largest fundraises in history" are too big to fit in a human head, here's a chart worthy of wtfhappened2025.com:

为提供参照，118个国家/经济体的名义GDP低于1000亿美元——约占全球所有经济体的61%。由于连续创纪录的"史上最大融资轮"规模已超出人类直观理解范围，以下是来自wtfhappened2025.com的图表：

AI Twitter Recap

AI Twitter 回顾

Hypernetworks for instant LoRA "compilation": Doc-to-LoRA + Text-to-LoRA

用于即时LoRA"编译"的超网络：Doc-to-LoRA + Text-to-LoRA

Doc-to-LoRA / Text-to-LoRA (Sakana AI): Sakana introduces two related methods that amortize customization cost by training a hypernetwork to generate LoRA adapters in a single forward pass, turning what would be fine-tuning / distillation / long-context prompting into "instant weight updates." The core claim: instead of keeping everything in an expensive active context window, you can compile task descriptions or long documents into adapter weights with sub-second latency, enabling rapid adaptation and "durable memory"-like behavior (SakanaAILabs, hardmaru).

Doc-to-LoRA / Text-to-LoRA（Sakana AI）：Sakana推出了两种相关方法，通过训练一个超网络（hypernetwork）在单次前向传播中生成LoRA适配器（LoRA adapters，Low-Rank Adaptation，低秩适配），从而摊薄定制成本，将原本需要微调/蒸馏/长上下文提示的过程转变为"即时权重更新"。核心主张：无需将所有内容保留在昂贵的活跃上下文窗口中，而是可以将任务描述或长文档编译（compile）为适配器权重，实现亚秒级延迟，支持快速适配和类似"持久记忆"的行为（SakanaAILabs，hardmaru）。

  • Text-to-LoRA: specializes to unseen tasks from just a natural language description (SakanaAILabs).

  • Text-to-LoRA：仅通过自然语言描述即可专门处理未见过的任务（SakanaAILabs）。

  • Doc-to-LoRA: internalizes factual documents; on needle-in-a-haystack, reports near-perfect accuracy on sequences ~5× longer than the base model context window, and even demonstrates a cross-modal trick: transferring visual information from a VLM into a text-only model via internalized weights (SakanaAILabs; recap thread omarsar0).

  • Doc-to-LoRA：内化事实性文档；在大海捞针（needle-in-a-haystack）测试中，在比基础模型上下文窗口长约5倍的序列上实现近乎完美的准确率，甚至展示了一项跨模态技巧：通过内化的权重将信息从VLM（Vision Language Model，视觉语言模型）迁移至纯文本模型（SakanaAILabs；回顾帖 omarsar0）。

  • Positioning vs long-context: explicitly framed as a way to reduce quadratic attention costs and avoid rereading long docs at every call — store knowledge in adapters rather than tokens (omarsar0).

  • 与长上下文技术的定位对比：明确将其定位为降低二次方注意力成本（quadratic attention costs）并避免每次调用时重复阅读长文档的方式——将知识存储在适配器中而非token中（omarsar0）。

  • Credit / prior art tension: One researcher complains that Hypersteer (hypernetworks producing steering vectors from text descriptions) did not get sufficient credit in later similar work (aryaman2020). There's also broad community excitement / "hypernetworks are back" reactions (willdepue, zhansheng).

  • 学术署名/先前技术争议：一位研究人员抱怨Hypersteer（通过超网络从文本描述生成引导向量）在后续类似工作中未获得充分引用（aryaman2020）。社区也有广泛反响/"超网络回归"的评论（willdepue，zhansheng）。

  • Open question raised: why not just use attention with an extremely long KV cache — i.e., is Doc-to-LoRA mainly about efficiency/serving cost? (hyhieu226)

  • 提出的开放性问题：为何不直接使用带有极长KV缓存（KV cache，键值缓存）的注意力机制——即Doc-to-LoRA是否主要关于效率/推理成本？（hyhieu226）

OpenAI financing + deployment transparency tooling

OpenAI融资 + 部署透明度工具

$110B funding round: OpenAI announces a $110B raise with backing from Amazon, NVIDIA, SoftBank, framed as scaling infra "to bring AI to everyone" (OpenAI, sama). A separate note from Epoch AI contextualizes the scale: The round would nearly triple total capital raised to date; The Information reportedly projects $157B cash burn through 2028, and this round + existing cash would roughly match that projection (EpochAIResearch).

1100亿美元融资轮：OpenAI宣布完成1100亿美元融资，由亚马逊、英伟达、软银支持，定位为扩展基础设施以"将AI带给每个人"（OpenAI，sama）。Epoch AI的独立注释提供了规模背景：该轮融资将使迄今筹集的总资本近乎翻三倍；据The Information reportedly 预测，到2028年将消耗1570亿美元现金，而本轮融资+现有现金大致与该预测相符（EpochAIResearch）。

Deployment Safety Hub: OpenAI launches a searchable site to browse "system cards" (previously PDFs) as a more accessible interface to deployment safety documentation (dgrobinson).

部署安全中心（Deployment Safety Hub）：OpenAI推出一个可搜索网站，用于浏览"系统卡"（system cards，此前为PDF格式），作为访问部署安全文档的更友好界面（dgrobinson）。

US DoD ("Department of War") vs Anthropic saga: supply-chain designation, backlash, and industry implications

美国DoD（"战争部"）与Anthropic之争：供应链认定、反弹及行业影响

Anthropic draws a line; tech reacts: A central flashpoint is Anthropic's public refusal to enable mass domestic surveillance and fully autonomous weapons (as characterized by posters reacting to Anthropic's statement), which drew rare cross-competitor praise and heightened attention to "red lines" in frontier deployment (mmitchell_ai, ilyasut).

Anthropic划定红线；科技界反应：核心爆发点是Anthropic公开拒绝支持大规模国内监控和完全自主武器（据回应Anthropic声明的发帖者描述），这赢得了罕见的跨竞争对手赞誉，并引发对前沿部署"红线"（red lines）的高度关注（mmitchell_ai，ilyasut）。

Designation shock + legal scope debate: Posts circulate a claimed DoW move to designate Anthropic a "Supply-Chain Risk to National Security" and to pressure contractors/partners — sparking arguments about legality, precedent, and chilling effects (kimmonismus, deanwball). One legal clarification: DoD can restrict what contractors do on DoD contract work, but likely can't legally ban contractors from using Anthropic in their private/commercial work (petereharrell).

认定冲击 + 法律范围辩论：帖子流传称战争部（DoW）计划将Anthropic认定为"对国家安全的供应链风险"（Supply-Chain Risk to National Security）并向承包商/合作伙伴施压——引发关于合法性、先例和寒蝉效应的争论（kimmonismus，deanwball）。一项法律澄清：国防部（DoD）可限制承包商在国防部合同工作中的行为，但可能无法在法律上禁止承包商在私人/商业工作中使用Anthropic（petereharrell）。

Economic/strategic fallout framing: The sharpest critiques argue this would damage US credibility as a business partner and potentially force hyperscalers/investors into impossible tradeoffs (deanwball); others note uncertainty until full details are known but still see a supply-chain designation as ill-fitting (jachiam0).

经济/战略后果框架：最尖锐的批评认为这将损害美国作为商业伙伴的信誉，并可能迫使超大规模云服务商/投资者陷入不可能的权衡（deanwball）；其他人指出在完整细节公布前存在不确定性，但仍认为供应链认定并不合适（jachiam0）。

Public sentiment spike: Posts highlight strong public outrage at the idea of a DoD-backed domestic surveillance program and punishment for refusal (quantian1, janleike). Many users signal "solidarity subscriptions" to Claude (willdepue, Yuchenj_UW).

公众情绪激增：帖子强调公众对国防部支持的国内监控计划及惩罚拒绝行为的想法感到强烈愤慨（quantian1，janleike）。许多用户表示要"团结性订阅"Claude（willdepue，Yuchenj_UW）。

Anthropic statement and intent to litigate: Anthropic posts an official statement responding to Secretary Hegseth's comments (AnthropicAI). Commentary highlights the line "challenge any supply chain risk designation in court" and emphasizes the dispute over restricting customers outside DoD contract scope (iScienceLuvr).

Anthropic声明及诉讼意向：Anthropic发布官方声明回应Hegseth部长的评论（AnthropicAI）。评论强调"将在法庭上质疑任何供应链风险认定"这一表述，并强调争议焦点在于限制国防部合同范围外的客户（iScienceLuvr）。

Meta-point: Regardless of where one lands on Anthropic's choices, many posts treat this as a governance precedent moment: who decides acceptable use, what due process exists, and how contracts interact with fast-moving model capabilities (kipperrii).

元观点：无论个人对Anthropic的选择持何立场，许多帖子将此视为一个治理先例（governance precedent）时刻：谁决定可接受的使用方式、存在何种正当程序、以及合同如何与快速迭代的模型能力互动（kipperrii）。

Models + leaderboards: Qwen3.5 expansion and "open model" rankings

模型 + 排行榜：Qwen3.5扩展及"开放模型"排名

Qwen3.5 new releases (Artificial Analysis summary): Alibaba expands Qwen3.5 with 27B dense, 122B A10B MoE, and 35B A3B MoE, all Apache 2.0, 262K context (extendable to 1M via YaRN per the post). Artificial Analysis reports Intelligence Index scores: 27B = 42, 122B A10B = 42, 35B A3B = 37, with notable agentic/task metrics like GDPval-AA 1205 for 27B, plus detailed tradeoffs (hallucination/accuracy and token usage — 27B used 98M output tokens to run the index) (ArtificialAnlys).

Qwen3.5新版本（Artificial Analysis总结）：阿里巴巴（Alibaba）扩展Qwen3.5系列，发布27B稠密模型、122B A10B MoE（Mixture of Experts，专家混合）和35B A3B MoE，均采用Apache 2.0协议，支持262K上下文（据帖子称可通过YaRN扩展至1M）。Artificial Analysis报告显示智能指数（Intelligence Index）得分：27B = 42，122B A10B = 42，35B A3B = 37，其中27B在Agent/任务指标表现突出如GDPval-AA 1205，以及详细权衡（幻觉/准确率和token使用量——27B运行该指数消耗了9800万输出token）（ArtificialAnlys）。

Arena leaderboards (Feb 2026): Arena posts Top Open Models for text and code. Text top-3: GLM-5 (1455), Qwen-3.5 397B A17B (1454), Kimi-K2.5 Thinking (1452) (arena). Code Arena top includes GLM-5 (1451) at #1, with Kimi-K2.5 and MiniMax-M2.5 tied at #2 (arena). Arena also highlights Arena-Rank, their open-source ranking package for reproducible leaderboards (arena).

竞技场排行榜（Arena leaderboards，2026年2月）：Arena发布文本和代码领域的顶级开放模型。文本前三：GLM-5 (1455)、Qwen-3.5 397B A17B (1454)、Kimi-K2.5 Thinking (1452)（arena）。代码竞技场榜首包括GLM-5 (1451)居首，Kimi-K2.5和MiniMax-M2.5并列第二（arena）。Arena还重点介绍了Arena-Rank，其用于可复现排行榜的开源排名包（arena）。

Perplexity open-sources bidirectional embedding models (claim): A thread claims Perplexity open-sourced bidirectional "Qwen3-retrained" embedding models (0.6B/4B; standard vs context-aware embeddings; MIT licensed) to improve document-level understanding for retrieval; treat as a third-party summary rather than primary release notes (LiorOnAI).

Perplexity开源双向嵌入模型（传闻）：有帖子称Perplexity开源了双向"Qwen3重训练"嵌入模型（0.6B/4B；标准vs上下文感知嵌入；MIT许可证）以提升检索的文档级理解；请视为第三方总结而非官方发布说明（LiorOnAI）。

Systems, inference, kernels, and RL training: bandwidth, ROCm, and off-policy RL

系统、推理、内核及RL训练：带宽、ROCm及离线策略RL

vLLM ROCm attention backends (AMD): vLLM announces 7 attention backends for vLLM on ROCm with KV-cache layout changes, batching tricks, and model-specific kernels; reported up to 4.4× decode throughput on AMD GPUs with an env var switch (VLLM_ROCM_USE_AITER=1) (vllm_project). A follow-up details MLA KV compression claims (e.g., ~8K → 576 dims) and throughput wins on MI300X/MI325X/MI355X (vllm_project).

vLLM ROCm注意力后端（AMD）：vLLM宣布支持ROCm平台的7种vLLM注意力后端，包含KV缓存布局变更、批处理技巧及模型特定内核；据报道通过环境变量切换（VLLM_ROCM_USE_AITER=1）可在AMD GPU上实现高达4.4倍解码吞吐（vllm_project）。后续详情披露了MLA KV压缩（Multi-head Latent Attention，多头潜在注意力）宣称（例如约8K → 576维）及在MI300X/MI325X/MI355X上的吞吐优势（vllm_project）。

DeepSeek DualPath I/O paper (third-party explainer): A ZhihuFrontier summary describes a DeepSeek+THU+PKU paper proposing system-level redesign of Prefill/Decode to exploit idle storage NIC bandwidth on decode nodes via RDMA, aiming at KV-cache movement bottlenecks for agentic long-context inference; includes claimed speedups (e.g., 1.87× on DS-660B) with caveats for smaller models (ZhihuFrontier).

DeepSeek DualPath I/O论文（第三方解读）：ZhihuFrontier摘要描述了一篇DeepSeek+清华（THU）+北大（PKU）的论文，提出对预填充/解码（Prefill/Decode）的系统级重构，通过RDMA（Remote Direct Memory Access，远程直接内存访问）利用解码节点上的空闲存储NIC带宽，旨在解决Agent长上下文推理中的KV缓存移动瓶颈；包含宣称的加速比（例如DS-660B上1.87倍），并附注对小模型的适用性限制（ZhihuFrontier）。

Kernel/infra chatter ("quack", Liger): A thread points to Dao-AILab's quack writeup on memory hierarchy bandwidth, plus a note that Liger not using cluster-level reductions for xentropy could explain slower performance in some settings (fleetwood___).

内核/基础设施讨论（"quack"、Liger）：有帖子指出Dao-AILab关于内存层级带宽的quack技术文章，另提到Liger未对交叉熵（xentropy）使用集群级归约（cluster-level reductions），这或可解释某些场景下的性能下降（fleetwood___）。

Off-policy RL for reasoning (Databricks MosaicAI): Databricks promotes OAPL (Optimal Advantage-based Policy Optimization with lagged inference policy) as a stable off-policy alternative that can match/beat GRPO while using ~3× fewer training generations, positioned as operationally simpler than strict on-policy loops (DbrxMosaicAI, jefrankle).

用于推理的离线策略RL（Databricks MosaicAI）：Databricks推广OAPL（Optimal Advantage-based Policy Optimization with lagged inference policy，基于最优优势的策略优化与滞后推理策略）作为一种稳定的离线策略（off-policy）替代方案，可在使用约3倍更少训练轮次的情况下达到或超越GRPO（Group Relative Policy Optimization，组相对策略优化），定位为操作上比严格的在线策略循环更简洁（DbrxMosaicAI，jefrankle）。

ERL vs RLVR (Turing Post explainer): A long "workflow breakdown" contrasts standard RLVR (scalar verifiable rewards) with Experiential Reinforcement Learning (ERL) inserting within-episode reflection/retry + distillation; cites reported gains (e.g., +81% Sokoban) and tradeoffs (pipeline complexity/compute) (TheTuringPost).

ERL vs RLVR（Turing Post解读）：一篇详尽的"工作流拆解"对比了标准RLVR（Reinforcement Learning with Verifiable Rewards，可验证奖励强化学习，标量可验证奖励）与ERL（Experiential Reinforcement Learning，经验强化学习，插入片段内反思/重试+蒸馏）；引用报告的增益（例如推箱子游戏+81%）及权衡（流水线复杂度/计算量）（TheTuringPost）。

Mamba-2 / GDN initialization bug discussion: Albert Gu clarifies a viral plot debate: main takeaway is an init bug materially affecting some results; also notes nuanced interactions in hybrids (e.g., "stronger" components can make others "lazy," with a related reference) (_albertgu, _albertgu).

Mamba-2 / GDN初始化错误讨论：Albert Gu澄清了一场病毒式传播的图表争议：主要结论是初始化错误（init bug）确实影响了部分结果；还指出混合架构中的微妙交互（例如，"更强"的组件可能使其他组件"懒惰"，并附相关参考文献）（_albertgu，_albertgu）。

item.title: [翻译] Construction Physics: 每周阅读清单 02/28/26
item.description:
标签: #住房 #房地产 #建筑许可 #城市规划

摘要: 本期阅读清单聚焦住房与制造业两大领域：研究显示洛杉矶的住房许可成本使开发商多支付50%溢价，且高端住房通过"过滤效应"可缓解整体供应紧张；同时，日本电视制造业正全面退出市场，而中国制造业的崛起对德国工业构成"二次冲击"，加之美国大型建厂项目仍面临环保诉讼等NIMBY阻力。

原标题: Reading List 02/28/26

Reading List 02/28/26

Welcome to the reading list, a weekly roundup of what happened in infrastructure, buildings, and building things. Roughly 2/3rds of the reading list is paywalled, so for full access become a paid subscriber.

欢迎阅读本清单，这是关于基础设施、建筑和建造行业的每周综述。约三分之二的内容设有付费墙，如需完整访问，请成为付费订阅者。

No newsletter this week, but I'm working on a longer essay about the history of Operation Breakthrough (a greatly expanded and more thorough version of an older essay) that will be out next week.

本周没有通讯，但我正在撰写一篇关于"突破行动"（Operation Breakthrough）历史的更长文章（这是一篇旧文的大幅扩展和更详尽版本），将于下周发布。

Housing

It's obvious that getting housing projects permitted in the US is often quite difficult, but it's not always obvious how difficult. Previous research by economist Ed Glaeser has tried to quantify this by estimating the "hedonic" value of land (how much people would pay for a given amount of land space), which gives an implied value for how much the "permit" portion is worth. Now Economists Evan Soltas and Jonathan Gruber have a paper out looking at how much of a burden permitting is in the city of Los Angeles in dollar terms. From the abstract: "Permitting costs are widely cited, but little analyzed, as a key burden on housing development in leading U.S. cities. We measure them using an implicit market for "ready-to-issue" permits in Los Angeles, where landowners can prepay permitting costs and sell preapproved land to developers at a premium. Using a repeat-listing difference-in-differences estimator, we find developers pay 50 percent more ($48 per square foot) for preapproved land. Comparing similar proposed developments, preapproval raises the probability of completing construction within four years of site acquisition by 10 percentage points (30 percent). Permitting can explain one third of the gap in Los Angeles between home prices and construction costs." Would love to see more research like this for other metro areas [X]

显然，在美国获得住房项目许可审批（permitting）往往相当困难，但究竟有多困难并不总是显而易见。经济学家Ed Glaeser此前的研究试图通过估算土地的"享乐价值"（hedonic value，即人们愿意为特定土地面积支付的价格）来量化这一问题，从而得出"许可"部分的隐含价值。现在，经济学家Evan Soltas和Jonathan Gruber发表了一篇论文，研究在洛杉矶市许可审批的负担究竟有多少美元。摘要中写道："许可成本被广泛引用，但很少被分析，作为美国主要城市住房开发的关键负担。我们利用洛杉矶'待发放'许可的隐性市场来衡量这些成本，在那里土地所有者可以预付许可费用，并以溢价将预批准的土地出售给开发商。使用重复挂牌的双重差分（difference-in-differences）估计量，我们发现开发商为预批准土地多支付50%（每平方英尺48美元）。比较类似的拟议开发项目，预批准将使在购地后四年内完成建设的概率提高10个百分点（30%）。许可可以解释洛杉矶房价与建筑成本之间差距的三分之一。"希望看到更多针对其他大都市区的此类研究 [X]

Restricting institutional investors from owning single family homes continues to be a major political talking point, but I remain unconvinced that this has much impact on home prices. More evidence for this: A 2022 ban on investors from buying homes to rent in the Netherlands didn't affect home prices [SSRN]. And there doesn't seem to be much relationship between institutional ownership and home price appreciation at the city level. [Progressive Policy]

限制机构投资者（institutional investors）拥有单户住宅仍然是一个主要的政治话题，但我仍然不相信这对房价有太大影响。更多证据：2022年荷兰禁止投资者购买房屋用于出租的禁令并未影响房价 [SSRN]。而且在城市层面，机构所有权与房价增值之间似乎没有太大关系。[Progressive Policy]

The Atlantic has a good article about how high-end housing can increase housing supply across income levels. When people move into a new, expensive unit, many of them will move from lower-cost units, which in turn will be occupied by people moving from even lower cost units, and so on.

《大西洋月刊》（The Atlantic）有一篇好文章，讲述高端住房如何能在各个收入水平上增加住房供应。当人们搬进新的昂贵单元时，他们中的许多人会从较低成本的单元搬出，而这些单元又会被从更低成本单元搬来的人占据，依此类推。

...three researchers looked in extraordinary detail at the effects of a new 43-story condo project in Honolulu. The building, called the Central, sits right behind the giant Ala Moana shopping center, halfway between downtown and the beachfront hotels of Waikiki. It comprises both subsidized and market-rate units, priced at around $780,000 for the former, and $1.25 million for the latter. What the researchers found was that the new housing freed up older, cheaper apartments, which, in turn, became occupied by people leaving behind still-cheaper homes elsewhere in the city, and so on. A new rung higher up the housing ladder permitted people lower down to climb. The paper estimates the tower's 512 units created at least 557 vacancies across the city—with some units opening up no empty apartments (if, say, an adult child moved to the Central from their parents' home) and others creating as many as four vacancies around town.
[The Atlantic]

...三位研究人员极其详细地研究了檀香山一个新的43层公寓项目的影响。这座名为"中央"（the Central）的建筑位于巨大的阿拉莫阿纳购物中心（Ala Moana shopping center）正后方，地处市中心和威基基海滩酒店之间的中点。它包含补贴单元（subsidized units）和市场价单元，前者售价约78万美元，后者125万美元。研究人员发现，新住房释放了更旧、更便宜的公寓，而这些公寓又被城市中其他地方离开更便宜住房的人占据，依此类推。住房阶梯上更高的新一级让下方的人得以攀爬。该论文估计，这座塔的512个单元在整个城市创造了至少557个空置房源——有些单元没有产生空公寓（例如，如果成年子女从父母家搬到中央大厦），而有些则在全城创造了多达四个空缺。
[The Atlantic]

When population peaked in various US counties. [X]

美国各县人口何时达到峰值。[X]

How home prices have changed in several countries over the last several years. Why are prices up so much in Mexico? [X]

过去几年几个国家的房价如何变化。为什么墨西哥的房价上涨这么多？[X]

IFP colleague Connor O'Brien noted that statistics about the skyrocketing age of homebuyers in the US is based on a mailed survey by the National Association of Realtors that is far higher than other estimates. [X]

IFP同事Connor O'Brien指出，关于美国购房者年龄飙升的统计数据是基于美国房地产经纪人协会（National Association of Realtors）的一项邮寄调查，该数据远高于其他估计。[X]

Manufacturing

It really seems to be the end of an era for Japanese TV manufacturing. A few weeks ago Sony spun off its TV business into a joint venture with China. Now Panasonic is exiting the TV business as well. "Today, it announced that Chinese company Skyworth will take over manufacturing, marketing, and selling Panasonic-branded TVs." [Arstechnica]

日本电视制造业似乎真的到了一个时代的终结。几周前，索尼（Sony）将其电视业务分拆为与中国的合资企业。现在松下（Panasonic）也将退出电视业务。"今天，该公司宣布中国公司创维（Skyworth）将接管松下品牌电视的制造、营销和销售。" [Arstechnica]

From the annals of "environmental laws give NIMBYs the tools to endlessly delay projects." Construction of a $100 billion Micron memory fab in New York is being held up by a lawsuit from six local residents who oppose the project. They're arguing that the environmental impact study (which took nearly two years to complete) was "unnecessarily rushed." [X]

来自"环境法赋予邻避主义者（NIMBYs，Not In My Backyard）无休止拖延项目的工具"的编年史。纽约一座价值1000亿美元的美光（Micron）存储芯片晶圆厂（memory fab）的建设正被六名反对该项目的当地居民提起的诉讼所耽搁。他们辩称，环境影响研究（耗时近两年完成）"过于仓促地推进"了。[X]

Expanding US electricity generation capacity has been bottlenecked by gas turbine suppliers, but it looks like the major manufacturers are significantly expanding their capacity. ""We expect at least 19 GW of total available equipment capacity by 2028, increasing to 49 [GW] and 76 GW by 2029 and 2030," Jefferies said." [Utility Dive]

美国发电能力（electricity generation capacity）的扩张一直受到燃气轮机供应商的瓶颈制约，但看起来主要制造商正在大幅扩大产能。"我们预计，到2028年总可用设备产能至少将达到19吉瓦（GW），到2029年和2030年将分别增至49吉瓦和76吉瓦，"杰富瑞（Jefferies）表示。[Utility Dive]

The Economist on the Chinese threat to German manufacturing. "What many Germans call the "China shock 2.0" plays into fears that the country's industrial heart is being hollowed out. In Baden-Württemberg, a rich state that holds an election on March 8th, candidates are issuing dire prophecies about becoming the "Detroit of Europe"." [The Economist]

《经济学人》（The Economist）关于中国对德国制造业威胁的报道。"许多德国人所说的'中国冲击2.0'（China shock 2.0）加剧了人们对该国工业核心被掏空的担忧。在巴登-符腾堡州（Baden-Württemberg），这个将于3月8日举行选举的富裕州，候选人们正在发出关于成为'欧洲底特律'的可怕预言。"[The Economist]

27th February 2026 - Link Blog

Please, please, please stop using passkeys for encrypting user data(via) Because users lose their passkeysall the time, and may not understand that their data has been irreversibly encrypted using them and can no longer be recovered.
